thread.title: ‘Get Out’ Review: Black, White and Terrific All Over - WSJ
thread.title_full: ‘Get Out’ Review: Black, White and Terrific All Over - WSJ

author: Joe Morgenstern
title: ‘Get Out’ Review: Black, White and Terrific All Over - WSJ
text:
@JoeMorgenstern Feb. 23, 2017 1:30 p.m. ET 
A memorable horror flick if ever there was one, “Get Out” starts with a great title and a promising idea—a black man’s fear as he walks at night down a street in an affluent white suburb. Then it delivers on that promise with explosive brilliance. Jordan Peele’s debut feature scrupulously honors the genre’s conventions. It’s creepy, funny and scary—truly scary. What makes it so special, despite some obvious flaws, is its prime location at the intersection of horror and race. No preachments are preached, no parables are dwelled on. This film never strays from the path of entertainment, yet the horrors of racism lurk... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
